Implementation of needed functions for GA.

Documentation

newChromosome #

Arguments

:: [(Int, Int)]

Database of (weight, value).

-> Int

Maximum amount of weight allowed.

-> IO Chromosome

New random chromosome.

Generate ONE new random solution.

This adds random items until weight restriction is met.

loadDatabaseFrom #

Arguments

:: String

Relative path to file containing weights.

-> String

Relative path to file containing values.

-> IO [(Int, Int)]

Database of (weight, value) for each item.

Load database from weight and value text files.

Expected format: each file contains same amount of lines in both files and each line contains one positive integer. Function DOES NOT check the value of integers!

defaultCrossover #

Arguments

:: [(Int, Int)]

Database of (weight, value) for each item.

-> (Chromosome, Chromosome)

Parents.

-> IO Chromosome

New chromosome created from parents.

Default implementation of crossover between 2 chromosomes.

Takes half (random set of indices) of items as chosen in first parent, rest from second parent. Does NOT check weight restriction.

defaultChooseParent #

Arguments

:: [Chromosome]

Generation of Chromosome to choose from.

-> IO Chromosome

Chosen parent.

Default implementation of choosing parent from last generation.

Choosing random chromosome with higher value than random fraction of best solution. This algorithm prefers better solutions but can also choose worse ones.

getRandInts #

Arguments

:: Int

Amount of random Ints to be generated.

-> Int

Max index.

-> IO [Int]

Unsorted list of non-repeating Ints

Get N random non-repeating unsorted Ints in range [0,maxIndex - 1]

If amount > maxIndex, returns pure []

>>> getRandInts 5 10
[3,7,1,5,4]

mutate #

Arguments

:: [(Int, Int)]

Database of (weight, value) for each item.

-> Chromosome

Chromosome to mutate.

-> IO Chromosome

Mutated chromosome.

Implementation of mutation of a given chromosome.

Changes decision for ONE random item in the given chromosome.

getRandNum #

Arguments

:: (Int, Int)

Interval [low, hi]

-> IO Int

Random int in interval

Get random int in range [lo, hi].

Does NOT check if lo <= hi.

getRandDouble #

Arguments

:: (Double, Double)

Interval [low, hi]

-> IO Double

Random Double in interval

Get random double in range [lo, hi].

sortWith #

Arguments

:: (a -> a -> Bool)

Comparing function.

-> [a]

List to sort.

-> [a]

Sorted list.

Sorts a list using merge sort algorithm.

data Chromosome #

Type used to store a solution.

Stores weight, value and list of items (True -> chosen, False -> NOT chosen)

Constructors
